title: Fix runtime error by adding global SoundProvider wrapper

requirements.text: Wrap the entire React app in the existing SoundProvider so any component calling useSound (including the homepage/feed via SoundEffectsManager) is always rendered within SoundProvider.

quotes: fix this error in the codebase
the homepage. likely the entire app
Should be globally wrapped in the existing SoundProvider

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to the homepage/feed no longer throws: "useSound must be used within SoundProvider"
SoundEffectsManager can call useSound without runtime errors on any route
The SoundProvider used is the existing provider from frontend/src/contexts/SoundContext.tsx (no duplicate/alternate sound context is introduced)

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any path listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.frontend.immutablePaths (including frontend/src/main.tsx and the Internet Identity/actor hooks).
Keep SoundContext logic centralized in frontend/src/contexts/SoundContext.tsx; only add the missing global provider wiring.
nonGoals: Do not change sound assets, volumes, or cue behavior.
Do not add new sound effects or new settings beyond fixing the provider mount.
